Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Berlin Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: portland27
Reviews.Content: Motel One is only 3 mins walk from AlexanderPlatz and S-Bahn stations. The hotel is basic but very efficient. It's geared up for visitors who only want a bed, shower and breakfast and does this well., and at very affordable prices. It is set up for short stay term business travellers and hence service is fast and German efficient. Breakfast is continnetal but sufficient, and coffee machines are good WiFi works, hotel concierge provides support for printing airline confimations and boarding passes, and the hotel is right on the main loacl and international train lines. We caught a ICE train from here to Frankfurt international and onto Perth and only had to carry our bags 300 metres all up. For a four day holiday in Berline without the frills this is teh place.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location + super minimalistic design”
Reviews.Author: Falk_Tel-Aviv
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it location. Close to all main public transportation lines and many points of interest. Then comes to design: minimalistic yet impressive. However, minimalism was taken a bit too far: (a) there are insufficient number of power receptacles in the room, most notably near the (minimalistic) desk; (b) there is no device or holder to place the soap or shampoo inside the shower. It seems that the designer did not wish to mar the continuum of the exquisite black granite space with any protrusions. Aside from that that stuff is very efficient and breakfast (extra charge, but pays for the in-room internet) is sufficient and healthy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place great price”
Reviews.Author: Ginette5811
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. Very clean, modern. It has a great buffet in the morning. Guy at the front desk recommended a fantastic restaurant down the street. Location was great we walked to the museums - no problems. Would definitely stay here again. Also close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: edu_iglesias
Reviews.Content: Although the word Motel could be missinterpreted, the hotel is very functional and very well located. Staff is efficient and nice. Only "problem", any consumption done at the hotel has to be settled right there. Not possible to charge it to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, trendy interior, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam_Chris123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a short meeting in Berlin and therefore arrived quite late in the evening/left early in the morning. However, I can say the hotel is perfectly located directly at Alexanderplatz. Therefore it's a great starting point when discovering the city but also when in town for business. The staff at the hotel was friendly, the rooms stylish and equipped with all you need during your stay. The bed was comfortable and the rooms well isolated. Good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: evilnim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with some friends. Clean, friendly and feels like a much more upmarket hotel than what you actually pay for. Decent location. Highly recommended for a short break on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “just okay -”
Reviews.Author: byswiss
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights at the motel one Berlin alexanderplatz while visiting friends in Berlin and for new year's eve celebrations. We choose the Motel One Berlin Alexanderplatz mainly because of location and because of limited availability among other hotels in the city. This was my first experience with the Motel Once chain/brand. Firstly: yes it's rather inexpensive: yet I would not call it good value. Mainly because hotel rates in Berlin are rather cheap in any hotel compared to other European cities and also because you get more for the same price with chains like Ibis or the AllSeasons properties. The hotel does position itself as trendy, design, fancy, whatever you wanna call it: and indeed there was an effort of decoration and loon'n'feel that went into the property and these things are always a matter of taste: yet it's nothing to write home about. The hotel is nicely located at just about 100m from Alexanderplatz station where you can catch multiple subway lines and commuter trains. It is also in decent walking distance to Berlin's most important museums and some of the main tourist destinations. The hotel faces on one side the very busy railway tracks, I can imagine those rooms are rather noisy. We were lucky enough to get a room that didn't face the tracks. The hotel features a rather big lounge area in the lobby with loads of seating available. There is free wifi in the lounge and breakfast is served here and you can get drinks and snacks all day from the bar. Rooms are VERY small! They are indeed smaller than anything you get at a similar price at competing budget chains. There is not even a cupboard to put your clothes away. With two people and some luggage: the room is literally crowded. Yes it's a budget hotel so I don't expect a lounge area or balcony or whatever... yet still at least an armoire and a place where to put my luggage. Rooms have AC which is good, not standard in Berlin. Generally both the rooms and bathrooms and the public areas of the hotel are very clean. The room did smell a little strangely however, which housekeeping did notice, so whenever they cleaned the room; they would have opened the window causing the room to be freezing every time we came back. Annoying... Also above average for this type of price range is the bathroom; its very small: so watch out when taking a shower (I did not manage a single time to take a shower without causing the entire bathroom to get wet...) yet its much better than what you get with similar hotels that will give you a plastic, pre-fabricated bathroom. Regarding sleep quality: its not great. The pillows are rather hard and unhandy: there is no extra pillow. Mattress is okay. We did not take breakfast. All in all: I can recommend this hotel for it's location only. Regarding actual price-value; you can get better options. +location +/- clean (yet room did smell funny) +/- bathrooms (small though) -room size (not even a cupboard) -sleep quality -no free wifi in room (ridiculous for a hotel that's supposed to be for GenY travelers)

Reviews.Title: “New modern chic”
Reviews.Author: travelbug1959
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to the closeness of the Alexanderplatz and the railway station. The motel was very new and tastefully decorated. Loved the walk in wardrobe - could fill it with 2 jackets. Breakfast was adequate, with a great variety of meats and cheeses. The staff were pleasant. We wanted to go to the Christmas Markets, they sent us to one, it was not real good, we ended up finding 2 really great Christmas Markets our selves.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel but take warm clothes”
Reviews.Author: Living_in_Hotels
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent budget hotel. I stayed here twice. - Room are very simple but are practical with a small table, TV. Confortable bed. Nice modern design. - Fairly quiet. (I was unlucky to have a neighbour room with a guy snoring loud but it was acceptable.) - Nice small bathroom (with marble and design sink). - Add a small fee to have breakfast and wifi in the room. - Location is very good, from Alexanderplatz you have public transports going to everywhere and a direct bus to Tegel airport (bus TXL). - Lobby is big and confortable. - The staff is very nice. However, take warm clothes if you come during winter. The heating is minimal. I used the temperature control of the room but it didn't have an effect. I told the staff that said they would check but nothing changed. The temperature was just acceptable to me as I was just staying for sleep but I expect that some people would find it too low.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kwjnewman
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, chic hotel. Excellent value, and the food and drink options were good. Great location right next to Alexanderplatz, though try to avoid getting a room on the side of the hotel which is right next to the railway line (could be noisy). All in all, a great and affordable base for seeing a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LondonTC
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend Motel One Alexanderplatz, after we've just had a long weekend (3 nights) in Berlin at the start of December 2011. This is a funky, modern, clean and functional hotel, ideal for a long-weekend break for sightseeing in Berlin. The Hotel is in an ideal location for the tourist visitor. Good access to transport links: the Alexanderplatz U-bahn and S-bahn station is just across the road, and buses run along nearby Karl-Liebnecht strasse/Unter den Linden. The hotel also offers a very good value breakfast buffet. Hotel is located just a few minutes walk from the famous Alexanderplatz (with the iconic Fensehturm or tv tower) in East Berlin. It's within walking distance of most of the major cultural sights and buildings off down Unter den Linden, so you can set off on a good sight-seeing walking tour of your own. It's also very close to the Hackescher Markt and Oranienburgerstrasse for a variety of restaurants, bars and shops. The Hotel staff were friendly, professional and very helpful. Our room was clean and modern, with a good shower, and it was all that we needed for a tourist visit when we tend to be out and about all day. The Hotel's motif is a funky modern design. For UK readers, in the UK the hotel would probably be a Premier Inn-type level - except the Premier Inn is not as nice. And if you're travelling as a couple for the Christmas markets (as we did), there are three or four Christmas markets within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “affordable and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: gabewong
Reviews.Content: i stayed four nights in this property and picked it because of its crawling distance from alex. if you need to get to an S or U bahn, you can't get any closer. the room was affordable (EUR65/night), modern design, equipped with the basic essentials and clean which is perfect for travellers who need a place to sleep. If you need a proper wardrobe, bathrobes, phone in your room, bathtub and room service, you might want to consider other options. Lovely lobby which is great for a drink but i'd avoid the morning breakfast rush with the business travellers and sneak across the road to the cafe which offers a great cooked breakfast and free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good, except both free & paid WIFI are nightmarish”
Reviews.Author: newyoika
Reviews.Content: this is a pretty decent place to stay in berlin, unfortunately their internet system is intensely frustrating. i paid for the in-room WIFI (5 euro/day, or 7,50 euro/day includes wifi + breakfast). when it's working, it's a decent connection, but it constantly drops out, the login in page re-loads on a loop, to the point you can't ever log in, sometimes the service disappears periodically or makes you log in again. sometimes you have to log in 3 or 4 times, or close & re-open your browser a few times before it finally connects. (i had trouble with all 3 browsers i tried). the WIFI flat stopped working at one point and there are no phones in the rooms, so you have to use your cell phone or (if you dont have cell service because you are a foreigner) try to convince reception to call for you on the front desk phone. at that point, the customer service person said the whole hotel system had to be reset which would take 20 or 30 minutes. also, sometimes it would let me log in on both my phone & my laptop, but often if i logged in on my phone, i would have to disconnect my phone for several hours before it would allow my laptop back on the connection. if you think going to the lobby for the free WIFI will help, you still have to ask the front desk for log in info, and some of the same log in, dropped service, & redirect issues occur. beyond that, its a great location, relatively clean (except carpeting is of a type that apparently doesn't vacuum well & could have been a bit cleaner without all the hairs and a toenail clipping or 2...but the room was quite clean for the most part), quite comfortable bed by european standards. room is modern & stylish. a bit inconvenient that there is no phone. window to street & train tracks kept out noise sufficiently enough for me. staff wasn't overly eager but was generally kind & helpful, not rude. the shower is lovely but doorless so it's impossible not to flood the floor & soak the bathmat. it's not perfect, but decent enough (and i got a great price) that i would make it my official place to stay in berlin IF not for the internet issues. im of a generation that internet connection should be free (or included in price), as it's about as essential as running water (from both business & tourist perspectives). so when you are asked to pay EXTRA for it, it really should work properly. i probably won't stay again just because of the frustrating internet.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Modern and Stylish”
Reviews.Author: Sunil-Globetroter
Reviews.Content: I reached Berlin from Frankfurt using ICE, and got down at AlexanderPlatz. I reached at about 10 in the morning and was suppose to reach office around 11. I had informed the front desk that i will be reaching a early and will require a room and to my surprise i was informed that non of the rooms are avaialble and and i can checkin only post 3:00 PM. I deposited my lugagge at Hotel reception and headed straight to my office. The Underground, Trams and Buses are just a walkable distance from hotel and can be reached in 1 to 2 mins. When i came back in the evening from office, i was handed over the key to my room. I now realised that this hotel is very Modern and Stlylish with a wonderful decor and interiors. I was in a lot of hurry in Morning and hadnt noticed anything. When i went in my room as well, i found the room to be quiet good, modern and very neat. The bed was quiet fluffy and i had a very good sleep. The internet in the room is not free, however the internet in the Looby is free and is quiet fast. There is a huge place to sit out in the reception where u can connect your laptop and browse as much as you want. You have a bar attached to this sit out area where u can order drinks and some snack as well. From the room you will be able to view the berlin TV tower which is quiet close by and so are the other tourist attractions in berlin. The room is not too cheap not very costly. I stay here for a period of 5 days and decided to check out of this hotel as i planned to stay for a longer time in berlin for work and was looking at options which had a attached Kitchen. If i ever visit Berlin for a short trip, then i will definitely checkin here cos of the advantage of the location. Its one of the best central locations in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Beware parking is not always available”
Reviews.Author: ckpd
Reviews.Content: We arrived to learn parking at this location is only available by CALLING ahead and reserving a spot. Not available via the internet. Thus we were directed to a parking lot approximately four or five blocks away. The dark haired desk clerk on duty Thursday September 15 and Saturday September 17 was very cold and non receptive and remained that way during our entire stay. She insisted our confirmation was wrong but insisted her way would be correct. She offered no apology for the lack of parking and directed us to a lot 10 minutes away. When I asked for driving directions to the lot she was almost upset to have to give them to e. The rest of the stay was better. The Motel One location was great for being in Alexanderplatz. Convenient to trains and all public transportation. Lots of shopping, cafes, etc. all within waling distance. Visit the food court in the Galleria! Typical Motel One hotel - consistent breakfast at a reasonable price. Internet available in our room with purchase of breakfast - strange deal Motel One has - if you purchase breakfast you can have internet in your room (not just in the lobby). Our A/C did not work in our room, but we chose not to complain about it. Honestly - I didn't want to deal with the rude desk clerk with the dark hair. Motel One management at this hotel - honestly - we almost left to find another hotel due to the treatment of the desk clerk. You need to state your limited parking at this location.

Reviews.Title: “like Economy Class”
Reviews.Author: RichardMainz_Germany
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern, clean and stylish in a polished and cool way. Does this justify a rate of 126 Euros for a single room? Even if there was a fair in Berlin at that time, I would say: no. Not only was the room on the small side - no problem with that actually - but also furnished Spartanly with very few amenities in the room and bathroom. Another weak point: the reception area is understaffed. In case several people are checking in at one time, one can easily wait for around ten minutes. Besides, I always find that advance payment, as practiced here, is not exactly a sign of hospitality. A plus point was the good quality of the breakfast and the attentive and friendly staff in the breakfast area. If you are in search of a conveniently located modern hotel (roadside rooms noisy with an opened window, though) this is actually not a bad choice but do not expect any thrills or nice touches.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Mix”
Reviews.Author: Dounia81
Reviews.Content: Motel One is one of our favourite places to stay in Berlin. It's got everything you need and it's beautifull: modern materials and design. Not very luxurious, but simple, basic and attractive. Although Berlin has an excellent breakfast-culture, we can recommand the breakfast of Motel One as well. Furthermore: Alexanderplatz is a perfect place to stay: very big station (with metro, tram and trains), so it's saves a lot of travel time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, smallish rooms”
Reviews.Author: kern22101
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the Motel One in July. The motel is RIGHT across the street from the train station and one block from several bus stops. The rooms are immaculate but smallish by American standards (normal by European standards.) The price is excellent given that it's in a central location in Berlin. We wished they had a restaurant in the hotel, however. I was told to walk to the train station to feed my kids which was a bit of a drag and insanely crowded. There are no restaurants really close by other than those in the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hboe
Reviews.Content: Motel One Alexanderplatz is the ideal city hotel in Berlin. Perfect location for arriving with the airport express and exploring the old East. The stylish rooms and bathroom are appropriately sized, and absolutely no sounds can be heard from the street or train tracks! This is really impressive! Breakfast is adequate; otherwise try the lovely, organic café (Spree Gold) just across the street. The staff is very efficient and nice. I definitely stay here next time I’m in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to rest up before going out”
Reviews.Author: kristineclarinda
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's a 2 star hotel. But they definitely work with what they got! It felt like The W on a very, very tight budget. The overall design was modern and colorful. It's definitely a trendy hotel that caters to a younger crowd. But the rooms were comfortable and we had no big complaints. We only really stayed here for cat naps and to sleep at night, other than that we were out all day. We were able to walk everywhere from here or take a taxi, but the train was right outside. Word of caution though: If you are going to need parking, make sure you reserve with them ahead of time. Or else you'll end up parking in front of the grocery store across the street! FYI- the rooms don't have phones and there are very few electrical outlets. So plan accordingly!

Reviews.Title: “don't look for better even twice the price”
Reviews.Author: floorams
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Motel One at Alexanderplatz. And again I was amazed to find the friendly service(helpfull staff, already anticipated that we would arrive late), the clean rooms (small though comfortable and fine shower) and the good (fresh) breakfast in a "Motel" This is a highly efficient quality hotel. You won't find a better place in this best part of Berlin (Mitte) even at a price twice we paid (EUR 79 pnight). You recognize the quality by it's visitors, young looking and young feeling people. The group of early beer drinking british men didn't disturb anybody since they were treated tactfully by the staf.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in an Ikea store, only not as nice.”
Reviews.Author: milepost99_99
Reviews.Content: modern (uncomfortable) design. Clean, no surprises, convenient if you want to be near Alexanderplatz. Skip the breakfast buffet - not worth the price. Dunkin' Donuts is around the corner. Try the restaurant across the street - great pasta dishes.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: klarat
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel in Berlin, rooms are small but lovely and clean, great breakfast and service. Perfect location. For short stay no.1!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geofflane
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is quite nice, with a great breakfast that's quite affordable compared to many other hotels. The rooms are clean and modern. It's very close to Hackerscher Markt which has great restaurants and pubs around it and is super close to the train so it's easy to get all over Berlin. The only complaint I had was that the doors slam very hard when they are closed and are quite loud early in the mornings if you're trying to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: da33Melbourne
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. It's right near good restaurants, shopping and great cocktail and river bars down the road. The room was very nice, modern and clean. The only thing that was a bit 'tight' was that you had to pay for using their lobby computer. If this was free, it would have completed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: yanik313
Reviews.Content: Very close to Alexanderplatz and shopping areas nearby. 20 min from Kurfurstendamm per underground. Excellent value for money, small rooms but very clean and modern. One part of the rooms are facing the railroad but the windows are almost soundproof. The only negative thing is that all chanels on TV are german except CNN and the breakfast area is a little bit uncomfortable but for the rest everything is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Steve1982uk
Reviews.Content: This place is no luxury hotel but it is very clean, simple, modern and more importantly very reasonably priced for the location, right by Alexanderplatz S- and U-bahns. The hotel is right by the railway lines but the double glazing means that it is impossible to hear it. Decent breakfast as well. Nb no telephones or kettles in the rooms - but you get what you pay for. Very recommended as an easy place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: helen118
Reviews.Content: This hotel has only been open since dec 10. All the staff are very nice and all speak good english. The downstairs area has a good bar and free wifi. It is also the place where breaky is served in the morning. It can get busy but there are plenty are staff to clean away the plates and the buffet is always well stock. The hotel is two minutes walk from the station. As a lady on her own i felt very safe. The hotel is on a very busy main road and has loads of bus routes on it. I had a room facing this road and didnt hear it at all. Good view of the tv tower. My bedroom was very comfortable. Bathroom good and shower nice and hot and powerful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price”
Reviews.Author: oliva
Reviews.Content: It´s not possible to find a hotel at a good price in this area,this one is new and clean, Although rooms are small and simple, they´re enough for a short stay. Bathroom is so tiny only one person can be there at a time. We chose a patio view room, so it was really quiet. There´s free wifi in the lobby (that didn´t work very well though) and if you have breakfast there you also can have wifi in your bedroom. The staff was kind, but the information given there wasn´t accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Clean...”
Reviews.Author: UspeakNYC
Reviews.Content: The look of this hotel is right out of an IKEA catalog. Simple, sleek and no-frills look. I didn't think it would be a nice stay but turned out ok. The room is a little on the small side and the bathroom has no tubs, just dorm-like. I found the lobby to be more inviting, spacious and comfortable to sit and browse on the internet. The area itself is not bad. This is a chain, so they have locations everywhere. The breakfast at least decent, fresh bread and some cheeses/jams to choose from. Overall I thought it was a good price and decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “looked dodgy - turned out brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: kazz8
Reviews.Content: will be honest, walking down dirckenstrasse and saw all the graffitti on the walls and did have second thoughts about where we were staying but glad we kept going. hotel is modern and well decorated with a large open-plan appeal to the main room. the bar has a nice range of drinks (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic). the room (we were in 413) was basic but lovely. the shower room was amazing - best hotel shower i have had. we could see the fersehnstrum (tv tower) from our window. (if you stood at an angle). the hotel is beside a busy train line but there was never any noise issues overnight. thankfully, the staff's excellent english made up for our poor german and the hotel staff gave excellent information about the area, including directions to supermarkets and other attractions. very impressive hotel and has encouraged us to look at the other hotels in the chain. will definately be staying there again. a little note of interest: if you do stay here, we highly recommend the PUB (pilsner unique bar). it is very close to the hotel and the staff were very kind and well... the beer is great too. :D

Reviews.Title: “Chic and excellent”
Reviews.Author: hochi1
Reviews.Content: I hadn't intended to spent much on my 24hr trip to Berlin, but for a first visit planned at short notice I was very happy to have found Motel One so close to the Alexanderplatz train station on Dircksenstraße 36 http://www.motel-one.com/uk/motel-one-search/berlin/hotel-berlin-alexanderplatz.html It's location is great for anyone wanting to explore the Mitte district or the 'Political' district of Berlin on foot. They offered a breakfast at €7 but I got a more 'local' version nearby. In the evening if you want to drink locally there's a pub around the left corner as you exit left out of the hotel, or if you want pub-grup carry on down that street and turn left again and there's a good little pub there also.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all, but cheaper hotels in the area worth considering?”
Reviews.Author: EssexPalin
Reviews.Content: Nice stay. Paid €99 a night inc breakfast so not the cheapest on offer in the area. Rooms small-ish but survivable for a short stay. Nice bathroom, although we had no soap for some reason. Rooms are either rail line side or court yard side. Stayed rail side for top veiws of TV tower, no noise problems at all due to good glazing (and im a light sleeper)! LCD TV in room. Under 5 mins walk from DB station. Breakfast OK but nothing too special about it, but its not too expensive. Oddly you eat it in the large reception area. Would be happy to return but the price wasnt too cheap overall and had other hotels not been booked could have stayed in Ibis or similar for less in same area.

Reviews.Title: “the most modern, warm designed hotel in Berlin for young people”
Reviews.Author: sunnyday265
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in a trip to Berlin in May 2009. We had no idea for Berlin and booked there because of the good price, although it wasn't very long since it started operating. When we entered the hotel we thought we had made a mistake,although later on we discovered that Berlin is a value-for-money top destination in every sense. I liked the harmony, the nice rooms, although bit small, the velvet light blue colour that existed everywhere, the amazingly comfortable armchairs (which i later bought one for myself when back home) in the lounge and rest area and the huge reception desk with friendly assistants during all day. we walked around 6-7 h. daily in and when back to the room the bathroom was really relaxing, always clean and tidy, as well as the room. We hadn't booked breakfast in advance but tried it the first day and then ate for all the following! Absolutely tasty and "cosmopolitan" and with products of famous brands. It is with no doubt my top reason to go back to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back...”
Reviews.Author: Butikken
Reviews.Content: Nice, modern, clean, quiet hotel situated perfectly right in the center of town right next to the Alexanderplatz traffic hub. There are a couple of minor things that annoys me about the hotel: 1) at peak hours you can spend some time waiting for the lift, 2) you cannot reserve a space in the (small) parking garage on the internet, 3) you have to pay for the internet in the rooms (but it is free in the lobby), and 4) the eggs (in the otherwise reasonable and cheap breakfast) are always boiled rock solid. But as most reviewers point out, this is not a luxury hotel but an “excellent-value-for-money-hotel. I have stayed there several times and I’ll be back…

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: OnceInALongWhile
Reviews.Content: Travelling through Europe, one expects to be looted in broad daylight by hotels, restaurants, pubs and even museums. That's why Berlin is so refreshing. Take European prices, slash it by 25%, and then remove a few Euros - that's Berlin price for you. Even so, Motel One offers excellent value for money. I stayed at Alexanderplatz (downtown Berlin) for about 65 Euros a night, and it was awesome. In no way was it a 'budget' hotel. My window literally opened out into the square, with an outstanding view of the TV Tower in all its 1960s charm, just 3 minutes walk away. Even closer is the Alexanderplatz station, which has connections to nearly every major landmark within the city (as well as, if I'm right, to other cities). My tour met at the entrance to the TV Tower (as do many other tours), so that was convenient as well. Alexanderplatz is also 'happening' with pubs, eateries and hangout joints just outside the main square. The Museum district (more like a square) and many other places of interest (DDR Museum, etc) are walkable, but one can also catch buses from the bus stop which is also just a few steps away. For such an awesome location, M.O.Alex's rates are very reasonable. Upon arrival, I got checked in in under 3 minutes. I arrived at midnight but there were no hassles at the desk. Payment is up-front, by cash or card. Ask the receptionist for your wi-fi login/password (its quick, and hey..its free!) The room was sufficiently large, very well done, and had just the right amount of furniture. The bathroom was a little small but spotless and well stocked. Breakfast is a buffet that an Easterner might label bland, but it worked. Mostly the usual European fare - Cereal, Croissant, butter/jam/spread, Juices, Tea/Coffee, Fruit salad. Nothing exciting but decent stuff to get you on your way. In summary - an outstanding option for tourists wanting an decent, clean place to stay in a good location at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - comfotable and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wiljo96
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here with my son. Very central location Alexanderplatz station just two minutes away for connections all over the city. And cross city buses 100 and 200 just around the corner too! The hotel is modern and minimalist but still has a comfortable and attractive foyer and sitting area. Rooms are simple and clean, although fairly sparsely furnished - not a lot of storage space, clearly designed for short stay visitors. All the same they are comfortable to sleep in overnight. Good buffet style breakfast is extra but you can have lots to eat! Staff very polite and speak english. Would definately recomment for short stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Leia082
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely to stay in, with large, clean rooms and centrally located to town and public transport. While our room faced the main street and was opposite to a busy train line we did not hear a thing through the double glazed windows. One of the best nights sleep we had the whole trip! Would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “the place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Padwala
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel from 30th sept to 4th oct. arrived late after a day of delays etc and was very pleased with the quick check-in. as it was our first visit, reception gave us a map of the city (nice touch) the rooms where small but an ideal base for us as we went out most mornings and only came back for an hour or so late afternoon to get changed for dinner. right beside the train station, a life saver after a day of sight seeing. room was very clean, and although small, really comfortable. city is great and well worth a visit. trains connect the entire city and we got a berlin 72 hr welcome card (25.90E) which paid itself back with the amount of money off discounts we got. all in all a great city, a bargain hotel, and a fantastic time. we will be back and we will use motel one alexanderplatz again!

Reviews.Title: “Simple and good.”
Reviews.Author: Lammi2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the Berlin inline marathon. As stated before the rooms are simple and clean.No closet,No phone and no alarm clock. As common in Germany the shower door only covers half of the shower opening.(it might get wet on the bathroom floor). The people at the front desk were good.And they did speak english. There are 12 parking stalls in the garage.You might want to request one at the time of the booking. Breakfast is 7.50 Euro.Fresh bread,cheese,salami,fruit,cerial,tea,coffe and juice. You can get a toast in the evening if you don't want to leave. Wifi is free in the lobby. NOTE WIFI IS FREE IN YOUR ROOM AND LOBBY IF YOU BUY BREAKFAST:) The walk from the hotel to Brandenburger Gate(start and finnish) is about 30-40 minutes. No safe in room or at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: jhnthmpsn
Reviews.Content: We visited Berlin to see family over the Easter holiday and stayed at Motel One in Alexanderplatz after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. The rooms and bathrooms are small, but clean and simply, but nicely designed. Our 10-year old daughter had a very comfortable trundle bed of her own. The place was busy, but the staff were helpful and considerate. The best part was the breakfast, which is excellent for the price, and the convenient location, close to shopping and good transport links. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Central, comfortable and modern.”
Reviews.Author: letsgo74
Reviews.Content: We were only in Berlin for one night and had a bit to sqeeze into our time there. The hotel was a short walk from the train station when we arrived, and a short walk to catch a bus to the airport when it was time to leave. The room was sparse, clean and cool thanks to the a/c. Even though it's adjacent to the train line, there was no discernable noise. Our room didn't have a wardrobe, just a rod with hangers, which was fine for us but may not be for others staying longer - and you def want to stay longer in the amazing city. A short walk to Hackescher Markt which has loads of shopping and dining options. Also a short drinnken walk home from the Weekend Club which has a great rooftop bar.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the best hotel in Berlin for young couples!”
Reviews.Author: DeborahBrito
Reviews.Content: The Motel One Alexanderplatz is the best option to stay in Berlin!!! It is really located right next to Alexanderplatz (from our room we could see the TV Tower) and very well served by public transportation (we arrived at Tegel Airport and there is a bus that goes from the airport to Alexanderplatz in 20 minutes and costs 2.10 euro) (buses and a Train and Tube station within 2 minute walk). Altough is located right next to the train lines, the neighborhood is the best! A lot of restaurants, design stores, small markets and a mall. You can walk in the street at 2 am without any worries. Within 8 minute walk you can reach the Island of Museums, the Berliner Dom and the famous avenue Unter Den Linden. The room was another great surprise! Its size was good, not very small, the shower wase very relaxing, there is AC (but in august there is no need to use it) and, altough our room faced the train lines, there was absolutely no noise at any time in the day/night, because the window is sound proof. The staff is lovely, helpful and speak english very well. We didn´t eat breakfast, it´s a little bit expensive (7.50 euro/each) for waht it offers. There is Wi-fi in the internet but it´s not free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: incagirlIreland
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, convenient to all the major tourist sights The rooms were clean, the shower was powerful. Not much hanging space for clothes. Our bedroom was not facing the railway station and was extremely quite. The continental breakfast was perfect to get you started for the day, €7.50 was good value. A selection of hams, cheeses, yogurts, breads, fresh fruit and various teas, juices and coffees were provided. The service was friendly and efficient. They stored our bag for free for 6 hours. They also have an outside area were you can have breakfast when the weather is hot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: indecisive266
Reviews.Content: The Motel One is in a fantastic location-great for Alexanderplatz and the trains/trams to see the City and also walking distance to most sights. The hotel is nice, it's well presented and simple. It's located right next to the railway but you can't hear it. The rooms are very clean and the bed made daily. The rooms are what they are...no frills...hard beds and very simple...no character. I would have liked a bin and a fridge in the room but that's no major thing! But rooms perfect to shower and sleep after a long day of sightseeing. (Room 640 smelt wierd tho so watch out!) I found the service a let down, i waited at the bar on 2 occasions and after 10 minutes of the receptionist just chatting to some guys i gave up and went elsewhere for a drink! Didn't have breaksfats but looked good. Location, loction, location! Great base, great stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Berlin”
Reviews.Author: smokielu
Reviews.Content: Basic clean hotel, staff very helpful. breakfast fine. The rooms are small. Very little space to hang clothes. We were aware of this & lived out of suitcase for 3 nights. The Motel is at the r/station.We wondered if it would be ok at night, & it was.It is right next to The TV Tower, no wait as we went in at 9 am. Well worth doing to get birds eye view of East & West. A boat trip on the Spree was wonderful as one could see the buildings clearly ( no leafy trees -winter time) Our taxi had great difficulty finding Solar restaurant . Shopping complex 3 mins. walk.

Reviews.Title: “Arrived in a heatwave - but what a cool place!”
Reviews.Author: yorks8353
Reviews.Content: Excellent value - as a single traveller they charge you less! Central for affordable S (incl Schonefeld airport link) - Alexanderplatz and Hackeschermarkt stations 5 minutes away - and U-bahn access and the TXL express bus to/from Tegel. Hotel and room decor amazing. Breakfast @ Euro 7.50 sets you up for the day with fresh food and unlimited drinks. Room airconditioning fantastic and hygiene standards high. Not 2 star but the lifts are a bit slow at busy times! Use Berlin's bus/tram/railway transit system to make the most of a visit - Normaltarif 2.10 eu for 2 hrs in one direction (eg TXL) and Tageskart 6.10 eu for unlimited travel through to 03:00 next day - but time punch your tickets and keep some chane for ease of use. This hotel is in the Mitte and there are some Thai/Tapas/Italian reataurants nearby. Hackescher Markt is quite trendy but the German food in most restaurants is heavy going. All in all a nice place to be based - they have a free map with various/walking tours featured which I would recommend - along with good shoes/sunscreen/bottled water from the nearby Asian supermarket! I found the young reception staff very helpful with good English and a lot of patience at busy times. I checked out at 12 noon and they stored my luggage free for 4 hours. Maureen deserves particular praise!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Clara16
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and service, the rooms are really clean and have a lot of space. The breakfast buffet is extremely good and varied! The staf is polite and helpful. The area near the hotel is really nice, with local restaurants (try Ms.Vuong) and shops. If you have a room facing the railway, it is a bit noisy if you open your windows. Otherwise, it is perfect and we would definitly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ReadMyReview
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Febuary with my boyfriend. The location is great, right next to alexaderplatz, It was a great base to get everywhere. The hotel staff on the check in were great, gave us loads of maps and information booklets and always helped us find out where to go or how to get there. The hotel decor is fab! It is a pity that there were no restraunt in the hotel but you're in the middle of Berlin so there's plenty of places around. The rooms were really comfortable, i loved the flames on the flat screen, it made it feel really warm on a snowy Febuary day! The shower was so nice, and we had a view of the TV tower from our room. It was a really good value hotel and I would stay there again, I would love to visit again during the summer

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Value for Money Hotel”
Reviews.Author: s_neill
Reviews.Content: Although ideally located (right by the Fernsehturm and two minutes' walk from Alexanderplatz Station, which is an interchange for tram, U- and S-bahn, and Airport Express trains) Berlin is such a big city it would be impossible to get by solely on foot; it is not necessary to stay so central, particularly with the excellent U-bahn which we used extensively in addition to a lot of walking. The hotel itself offers tremendous value for money and its furnishings and décor are both incredibly modern and everything about the place just feels right. Breakfast, of the continental kind, is superb, particularly the bread rolls, and sensibly priced at EUR 7.50. It is, unusually, served in the reception/bar area which is on the ground floor and all intrinsically linked. Bedrooms are spotless, cleaned daily with towels replaced at the same frequency. The rainforest shower is tremendous and a pleasure to experience. The room is on the small side with only one seat. The flatscreen TV, mounted on the wall, is small and provides mainly German channels. All I would say is, if you like to sit and relax in your room at the end of the day, require evening meals at the hotel or enjoy a room with a view (it's not on the best block in town but at all times we felt safe, as we did in the rest of Berlin for that matter) this hotel might not be for you. None of this was a problem for us and I would have no hesitation in using this chain in future or recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “If I ever go back to Berlin I will stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Curlytop1110
Reviews.Content: Great location, right near the TV Tower so you can get your bearings easily. Handy for Alexanderplatz S and U Bahn. Turn right out of the hotel and you enter an area with bars, cafes, restaurants, supermarkets and trendy shops. Lovely decor, very comfortable rooms, fantastic shower. I slept like a log in the comfy bed. Friendly and helpful staff, who are immaculately presented in their smart uniforms. The breakfast is well worth the 7,50 Euros - delicious and varied food on offer: fruit, cereals, croissants, bread rolls. All food is replenished regularly so nothing ever runs out. Great value for money. In short, if anyone ever asks me where to stay in Berlin I will recommend this hotel. If I return to Berlin, which I would love to do, I will stay here again. If I visit another German city, I will definitely opt for a Motel One. This hotel exceeded all expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: akvajuba
Reviews.Content: A quite new hotel at a great location. It is centrally suited and in short distance to several main attractions. Our room was lovely and functional with a comfortable bed. The internet wifi was free and signal was trong. Although the buffet breakfast was not included in the rate (6.50 Euros) but it was very good. There was not a restaurant in the hotel, but thanks for it’s great location, there were many restaurants and fast food shop just around. We can have something to enjoy at anytime. Overall, great location, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gallaghertron
Reviews.Content: This review is coming a little late... I stayed here with friends in December of 2008. The location of this hotel is absolutely perfect. While not in the city center, you literally stumble right into the the subways Alexanderplatz stop when you leave the hotel. It only takes a few minutes to get into city center from there. The hotel has few frills, but is in excellent condition. Rooms were small, but felt new, and were clean/modern. The beds and linens were all comfortable. Be aware that if you are sharing the room with a friend that the twin beds are extremely close to eachother, in fact it could be one big bed. The bathroom is small but has everything you need. The lobby of the hotel is small but does offer one computer with free internet access, Another plus to this hotel is that there was a pretty good 24 hour gyro shop right next door. It was great for when we were coming back from the bars and needed good/cheap food. All in all.. this is just a GREAT choice. I normally book higher star rating hotels, but stayed here to match my friends budgets. It worked out so great I would definitely stay here again. There is no reason to pay city center hotel prices when you can still get downtown in just a few minutes from this clean nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel that punches above its weight”
Reviews.Author: foohan2001
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to fin out that the hotel is a 2 star. It is better than most three star and a lot of four star hotels in terms of decor. Rooms are smallish but big enough. Good location and easy walking distance to most attractions which makes it perfect for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “great location very clean and quiet no-frills but all mod-cons and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ernestjames
Reviews.Content: stay here if you want to go to explore berlin but need a place to sleep every night the location is excellent - right in the heart of Mitte District free wi-fi in hotel lobby, an excellent buffet breakfast for EUR 7.50 and really simple hotel concept we booked this hotel on the day of travelling to Berlin via their website - EUR 69 per room! unbelievable value and very friendly staff when we arrived

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snowmansam
Reviews.Content: Right next to alexanderplatz this hotel is with in easy reach of Berlin's transport network Good value for money and very comfortable rooms, in a capital city there's not a lot more you can ask for. We chose to opt out of the breakfast as there is better VFM outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, MODERN, GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: LindaA45
Reviews.Content: Motel One does exactly what it says on the tin - rooms are small but spotlessly clean and the bathrooms are fab, my only one gripe was that instead of a wardrobe we just had a rail to hang our clothes on and there were no drawers but we got by. Excellent breakfast, plenty of choice and was included in the price we paid. Really handy for the bus and train and the Unter den Linden.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Great Breakfast, Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lotsofwhiteroses
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel for 4 days in October and were very pleased we had booked! The pluses: 1. Comfortable and extremely clean rooms and shower rooms 2. Location - right beside all forms of public transport and a 10 minute walk to the centre of town. Hotel is soundproofed against the trains that run nearby 3. Great breakfast to start the day 4. Free wifi in the One Lounge/Reception area if you have your own laptop 5. Friendly staff (a rarity in the rudest capital in the world) The minuses: 1. Rooms lack telephones 2. No baths, just showers - mind the odd stream of boiling hot water that shoots through every couple of minutes 3. Wifi is charged if you use it in your room, so you have to go downstairs to use it In the area: For a local shop to get snacks, water etc - turn right at the hotel main entrance and 200 yards up the street on the opposite side is a supermarket called 'BioCompany' For local restaurants - there are a couple on the street but better selection available at the top of the street in the Hackescher Markt area. Beware 'Ossena' - cheeky waiters ask for hefty tips. For good shopping - the Galerie on the Alexanderplatz was the best shopping mall we went to - far better than Kudamm which was well outside our budget (and a pretty boring street too)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautifully designed hotel/rooms”
Reviews.Author: WJ912001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in late July 2009 as part of a tour of Europe. Relative to the city and the sights, this location was great, especially in terms of public transportation. It is about 3-5 minutes away from Alexanderplatz train station (both U and S bahn). It had both the 100 and 200 double-decker bus lines a block away on Karl-Liebknecht Strass, which eventually becomes Unter den Linden. We especially liked that you could take the TXL express bus from around the corner straight to Tegel Airport. The immediate surroundings definitely have the industrial East Berlin vibe -- directly outside the hotel are graffiti walls and nightlife is young and rowdy. The hotel itself is incredibly modern, chic, and brightly decorated. In the lobby, there is a bar, breakfast seating, and lounge area, all with free wifi. The room was on the small side, but clean and well-decorated. We had a view of the train tracks and the TV tower. Street noise was not a problem. Shower was great - modern and clean. Service was not overly friendly, but quick and efficient. At 84 euros/night, it was a decent value, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful location. But a pretty cheap motel.”
Reviews.Author: DrHickenlocher
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'm sure the term "Motel" doesn't have the same negative connotation in Berlin as it does in America. From all outward appearances, Motel One is a decent business hotel along the lines of a Holiday Inn Express. Unfortunately, my wife and I found the accommodations a little closer to Motel 6. Motel One Alexanderplatz is in an almost perfect location. The bus stop to the TXL Express is about a block away. The S-Bahn and U-Bahn train stations are just across the street, complete with all their cheap fast-food joints. All the shopping you could want in Berlin is around the Alexanderplatz plaza itself. Museum Island is about a kilometer's walk away, with Hackesche Hof even closer. The location alone earns the place 3 out of 5. Unfortunately, the accommodations themselves were just adequate, and we're far from snobbish people. We're the type to stay in Hilton Garden Inns, not Westins, just looking for someplace clean and decent to give us what we need. Unfortunately, we didn't get it all here. THE GOOD: * The location, as I've said. We were doing the City Segway Tour (HIGHLY recommended. Give Walid a raise!), which is right across the street at the TV tower. * There's also an internet cafe/telephone center at the RENT A BIKE right next to Fat Tire Bike Tours. Calls to America were 0.75 Euros to connect + 0.09/minute. We were able to call home for about 1.50 euros each night without buying a calling card. Definitely recommended if you're only going to be in town a short while. * The TV had a channel playing EUROSPORT! I could watch the US Open!!! THE BAD: * There's no phone in the room. At all. I guess the business hotel assumes everyone has cell phones. Good thing we found that telephone center across the street. * There's no safe in the room. The only hotel not to have it, we instead had to keep our passports and valuables on our persons. Mildly annoying. * The shower would go scalding hot about once a minute. You could feel it happening, giving yourself time to get out of the way. But it wasn't an isolated incident. Two straight nights, showers for both myself and my wife. Six minute shower = six times you have to duck out of the way, not good when you've got facial soap creeping into your eyes. * As usual in Europe (except in our Rome hotel!), the shower only had a half-partition of glass, meaning a lot of water ended up on the floor. The shower also had the weakest pressure of our three hotels, despite only being on the 2nd floor and supposedly in the "newest" building compared to Paris and Rome. * Also as usual in Europe, the outlets were recessed, meaning one of our converters couldn't get into the circular hole, and was useless. * No double bed. The two single beds were pushed together, but had separate sheets over the futon mattress and separate blankets as well. When my wife and I tried to cuddle, the mattress would slide on the wood platform away, and one of us would fall in between the two mattresses. * Unfortunately, we also met the only German staff employee who wouldn't smile at us. Our waiters at restaurants were great. Museum staff were quite pleasant. Even other Motel One staff were very polite, one gentleman trying to get a restaurant reservation for us (though the place turned out to be closed that night for a private party). It was so nice to have such friendly Germans after the comparably aloof Parisiens... except for Claudia. She was highly efficient at the front desk both checking us in and out two days later. But she was perpetually frowning in a military sort of sternness. Smile for your guests when the arrive, huh? GOOD TO KNOW: * I think Wi-Fi is free in the lobby, but we didn't have a computer. The "business center" was a desktop that charged 6 Euros an hour or something. The Internet cafes at Fat Tire or RENT A BIKE charge like 2 Euros an hour. Internet is NOT free in the room. * There IS a pay phone down the street, as long as you can brave the cold. Again, no phones inside. Fortunately, the front desk DID call to make try and make that reservation for us. * The train tracks literally run right behind the hotel. Fortunately, the glass is pretty good at soundproofing. You can hear trains if you try, but if you're not listening for the sound, you probably won't notice. * There is a market across the street from the Hackesche Hof restaurant, a few blocks away, if you want to buy cases of water and sodas and snacks. All in all, Motel One was in the perfect place. But if you have any desires to have a phone, a hotel safe, a bed that doesn't slide you away from your loved one, or a shower that won't scald you, try and find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sashina
Reviews.Content: I am always dubious of hotels located near man railways stations however couldn't fault this branch of Motel One. It's a minute's walk from the express bus from Tegel Airport: brilliant! And just around the corner you have the great shops and restaurants of Mitte. I was on the first floor immediately opposite the train tracks however with the window closed noise was no problem. Staff were extremely friendly. The room was comfy - no complaints there! Finally, this hotel charges less for single occupancy: well done Motel One! (I was had originally booked or 2 people and had to change, and was surprised to be offered a cheaper rate for just me - a big thumbs up!) The only minor drawback was that the curtains didn't close properly and passing trains created a strobing effect... but this was overcome by strategic placement of a chair to close the gap.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a short stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: mas_kjg
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Motel One was better than we could have expected. Our room and bathroom were comfortable sized and impeccably clean. Highlight was coming back from a long day of sightseeing and having the relaxing aquarium come up on the TV screens in the room and the soothing music! The turquoise décor is very trendy and the whole place looks very modern. We had no problems at check in, although had to pay up front. The motel is a 5 minute walk from the train station and is conveniently located right by the TV tower. Plenty of restaurants, cafes and bars nearby (we didn't eat at the motel). For the price we paid, this was much fancier than we thought! Only downside is having to pay for internet use as we didn't have our own laptops. However, for a short stay in Berlin, we would highly recommend Motel One Alexanderplatz.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: vanessm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Motel One Alexanderplatz for the second time earlier this month and was not disappointed (don't think it's possible). Located very close to the U and S-Bahn - walking distance to shops and restaurants, clean room, nice bathroom, great prices... what more could you ask for? Definitely would recommend

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: birtleman
Reviews.Content: Location, location,location. Great value very clean and quiet. Good breakfast. This property is close to every thing in Berlin and has great transportation at the door. The whole property is spotless. The staff were very nice and helpful. The only negative which is minor is that they do not have free internet unless you have your own lap top. The internet in the lobby is good but expensive. We would stay here again and would highly recomend the property, in fact we would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, very cute. Gets the job done.”
Reviews.Author: mattkorey
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best value for money in Berlin. Great location, buzzy atmosphere in the lobby, nice design, great price. It is especially good when staying for a short time or in combination with another hotel. I've stayed here a few times and it is reliable and cozy. Pair it with the Radisson a few blocks away and you are all set.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best cheaper places to stay”
Reviews.Author: SCC2104
Reviews.Content: The problem with many Berlin hotels is that they are in old buldings and get very noisy. Motel One is a new building so is nice and quiet. It's big plus is the location, neatly between Alexanderplatz and Hackescher Markt. The rooms are basic, no wardrobe or safe but are clean and the bathrooms modern and the beds are comfortable. I did not bother with breakfast as there are too many other places to try. It needs free internet access or free wifi in the rooms but I can live without it. Stayed their last year and have booked again for this year. I have stayed in many Berlin hotels and this is the one I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: thisgirlnamedsam
Reviews.Content: I just stayed in Motel One Alexanderplatz for 2 nights and it was a really great experience. This hotel is really clean, bright, well decorated, has a great staff and for leisure you can't beat the location! It is literally about 2 blocks from the TV tower and trains which is a great landmark. The staff spoke English well, and were very helpful. And the breakfast in the morning was delicious, if you can get it with your room you might want to, otherwise I think it was 7,50 eu. All in all a wonderful hotel to stay at in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Kooteraya
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, perfectly placed at Alexanderplatz, only minutes from the U-Bahn, S-Bahn and trams. Hotel staff extremely friendly and helpful, we were asked if we'd been to Berlin before and when we replied 'No', we were offered a room on on a high floor with a good view of Berlin. We could see the TV tower, Alexanderplatz station, Hackesche Hofe, Rechstag and the S-Bahn tracks from our window which was perfect. There was some noise from the S-Bahn tracks but this was minimal if the windows were closed, we did open the window a couple of nights and you can hear the announcements from Alexanderplatz statio, however I was a huge fan of the S-Bahn, so this only added to the experience! The room size was not huge, but was perfectly adequate for us. The decor was just as the hotel website shows, and the addition of the flat screen tv with 'fish and sea' screensaver was very relaxing! Unfortunately I was ill during our stay but the hotel staff were more than happy to provide hot water to take Lemsip (or the German equivalent) when I needed it. Also the good view from the room was a bonus when I was stuck in bed! I also ended up travelling back to the hotel alone on several occasions when I just needed to rest and felt very safe walking alone around Alexanderplatz (I am a young female)and it was very easy to hop on the S-Bahn back to the hotel. The only down side was the lack of storage space for clothes, but thanks to Tripadvisor we had been forewarned and so took plenty of coathangers in preparation! For the length of time we stayed, it was not an issue at all. Aside from that, we could not have wanted more from a hotel in Berlin, for the money it was great. We are hoping to go nack to Berlin in the near future and will be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Crowded and impersonal”
Reviews.Author: MrKnolly
Reviews.Content: Granted Motel One is everything it sets out to be and it is very well located. But two factors gave me a dissenting view. Firstly check-in was a nightmare: there were groups of people crowding the reception area and I had to queue for ages to be told that my room was not ready. When I returned exhausted several hours later I had to queue again to be told that it was still not ready. Secondly I think they have taken the minimalist formula too far when there is no plug for the washbasin. There are much more relaxing and less impersonal budget hotels to be found in Berlin and I intend to try out a few more of them before returning here. Still, you pays your money and you takes your choice, and there are plenty of people who will find Motel One just the ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Design, essential comfort, excellent location, and moderate price”
Reviews.Author: Pippononlosa
Reviews.Content: What you will find : - comfortable tiny room with nice design, with flat LCD TV and DVD player - all very clean - many rooms with a view onto the Fernsehturm - very good buffet breakfast with great choice of delicatessen, cereals, breads, croissants, eggs (no hot dishes) - free WiFi access in the lobby (not for free in the rooms) - excellent location and access to all transportation means - a five-minute walk to the Scheunenviertel area with a large choice of restaurants What you will not get : - no shelf, no cupboard in the room - no minibar, no telephone - limited choice of amenities in the bathroom Design, essential comfort, excellent location, and moderate price : if this is what you are looking for, Motel One is for you and is worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, good choice”
Reviews.Author: Carl73
Reviews.Content: Excellent location next to Alexanderplatz and a great choice if you can accept simple rooms without much luxury. The breakfast is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “nice but low quality”
Reviews.Author: TEST5
Reviews.Content: very good location to public transportation and to Alexanderplatz. Tiny rooms, but clean. No service available (no phone on the room)

Reviews.Title: “great location, value & service”
Reviews.Author: HurlersIreland
Reviews.Content: Motel one is great value, spent 2 nights in Berlin. This is great location, walk to Alexanderplatz for tube into city and train to airport . Excellent restaraunts (Thai Inside super quality food & value just up the street) and bars within walking distance. While right across from train with window closed you would not know. Staff very helpful, breakfast good value at €7.50. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Devon_girls
Reviews.Content: We paid €79 a night and for that money it was more than worth it. Just outside Alexanderplatz station its central location is amazing. Lots of nice bars and restaurants near by. staff very nice and helpful. rooms very clean nice shower and comfy bed. this is all you need for a long weekend away. Will deffo go back! Don't eat breakfast there its not good, thats my only (small) complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great vfm”
Reviews.Author: luffsun
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it seemed fairly central and affordable. Was really pleasantly surprised by the standard of the hotel - the rooms were reasonably basic in terms of facilities but everything was designed and finished to a high standard. The breakfast was good (although a little pricey now that the £ is so weak) and the staff were extremely helpful and managed to decipher my attempts at German. The hotel is right next to Alexanderplatz station but you cannot hear the trains - when we opened the window to get some fresh air (I accidentally made the room boiling by turning up the thermostat!) we were surprised by how much we could hear. The instant you close the window you can't hear a thing. We were at the side of the hotel facing the station so I expect rooms at the back of the hotel (and they did offer us a choice when we checked in) can open the window without a great deal of noise. Overall we found this the perfect place to base ourselves in Berlin and will be returning there for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlh282
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel if you like quality budget travel. If you're looking for the 4 Seasons you will be disappointed. If not, you will be thrilled. Incredibly clean rooms. On-suite bathroom. Fantastic breakfast. Friendly staff. Close to the train, but if you shut the window you will never notice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: septmon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Motel One - Alexanderplatz for two nights in December and highly recommend it. It's like a boutique motel. Decor-wise, it is modern with the chocolate and turquoise color scheme, shag rugs in the lobby and a flat screen tv with a simulated fireplace video playing. The rooms, while small, are nicely decorated and include small flat screen TVs (that do play American DVDs). It's in a great location - within walking distance of the train station and bus lines (we caught the bus to Tegel airport quite easily), major sights, and many bars, shops, and restaurants. It really is excellent value for the money. Our stay ended up costing $95/night including all taxes and fees. The hotel also offers a breakfast buffet for 6,50 euros, which initially seemed pricey for yogurt, cereal, juices, breads, and coffee, but ultimately was quite convenient for us on our last morning there as we needed to get to the airport and didn't have time to search for a breakfast spot. There is a supermarket about a block away for those who would rather spend money on other things and save money on food. I definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Setting the standard for budget hotels in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: nycdave
Reviews.Content: I'm normally a very tough critic of the places I stay, so it was not easy for me to check off "5 stars" for my rating of this place. In fact, it was very tempting to give it just 1 star to drag the average down, so that hopefully there will be vacancies next time I visit Berlin! But the sheer value that this hotel offers for the price is something I have yet to see anywhere else I've traveled. There are bones that can be picked (and I shall pick at them), but this... this is what hotels twice the cost should aspire to! The Motel One Alexanderplatz is a brand-new building (when I looked it up on google earth, it was still a parking lot), built just off of Alexanderplatz proper -- which is about as ideal a location in Berlin as you could hope for. It is a very spread out city, with many different neighborhoods and areas, each with their own "center." But Alexanderplatz is about as near as you can get to being in the center of the center! You're around the corner from the express bus stop to/from TXL, and a block away from the Alexanderplatz train station (regional and S-bahn trains), U-Bahn stations, and tram stops. Not only that, you're right next door to one of the bigger department stores (Galleria Kaufhaus... it's not KaDeWe, but it will do in a pinch if you need a pair of shorts), and one of the biggest tourist destinations (the Ferhnsehturm -- which also works as a handy landmark to navigate by). Other major attractions, like the Rotes Rathaus, Nikolaiviertel, Museuminsel, Neue Synagogue, and others are in easy walking distance. Those with a thirst for nightlife will find Club Weekend catty-corner across Alexanderplatz, Kino Internationale just down the road, and the legendary Berghain a cheap cab ride (or rather long drunken stagger) away. I'm not sure if there's any other ways to say "the location is perfect," so I'll move on to the hotel proper. The design is clean, cool, and contemporary, with a lovely series of lounges with free wi-fi on the entrance level. Drinks, coffee, and light snacks are available, and in the morning, a large breakfast buffet that is arguably worth the 6 Euros/day extra. The front desk staff tends to the young, attractive, and very helpful. I had a package sent to me when I first stayed here, but it got held up in customs until after I had left. I figured it was a loss, but when I made a return trip (I really loved Berlin) over a month later, the staff remembered me, and the package, and presented it to me on check-in! The rooms are small, but the minimalist decor and cool tones help keep it from being claustrophobic. The big windows open, depending on what room you have, on the back courtyard, Rosa Luxembourg Strasse, or... the massive, 4-track elevated Stadtbahn running through the city (the Alexanderplatz station is just east of the hotel). The first time I stayed here, I had a room facing this, and was surprised by how quiet it was. I was, however, on the 7th floor, so I'm not sure if the noise would be worse on lower floors or for light sleepers. But for someone who's loved trains since he was a kid, it was, if anything, an extra perk! The bed and pillows were very comfortable, climate control was a cinch. I do wish that there was a proper desk chair in the room, however... sitting on a cushioned cube for too long isn't very comfortable on the back. I'd suggest an alternate arrangement if you're planning on spending a lot of time in your room working on business at the desk. Also, wi-fi, while available in the rooms, is EXPENSIVE. Not only is it overpriced, but your time will continue to run out whether you're logged on or not. Again, there is free wi-fi down in the lobby/lounge, but if you're planning on doing a lot of emailing and chatting from your bed, be prepared to fork over some Euros. The bathroom unfortunately has a shower that doesn't close, making it almost certain that you WILL get the floor wet, no matter what you do. It was, however, clean, nicely laid out, and not too cramped. The toiletry products are on the cheap side, so you might want to bring your own, or pick something up at a convenience store. Everything was cleaned thoroughly and promptly by housekeeping. All in all, I don't think I could have been happier. Their price could almost double, and it would still be a reasonable value (though at that point, I might consider upgrading to something bigger, with a bathtub and more amenities). However, at the prices I paid (about 50 Euros/night), Motel One Alexanderplatz was an incomparable value. You can keep your eyes open for other good values in Berlin, but if the price is still good, you will NOT be disappointed with this hotel. Great location, wonderful staff, quiet peaceful rooms.... What more could one ask for!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and great location”
Reviews.Author: brufig
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Motel One for a few nights while I was in Berlin for a conference and was gobsmacked by the quality and service I got for the price. The hotel is very nicely decorated, with amazing attention to detail. Everything was spotlessly clean and the room was very comfortable. Breakfast was great and they offer free wi-fi in the lobby. You just It's located right next to the train station at Alexanderplatz, but the rooms are very well insulated so I couldn't hear a thing. Usually I'm a bit weary of Train station locations but this one is not shabby and I felt perfectly safe walking by at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wiztin
Reviews.Content: Great location, within walking distance to all the major attractions. Although directly opposite the rail tracks, with the windows closed I didn't hear any noise and found the room to be very quiet - I am particularly fussy when it comes to having a nice quiet room to sleep in. The rooms, whilst small and without proper wardrobe space, are clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom had great water pressure - just take your own soap as they don't provide it. Breakfast was good - bread rolls, selection of cheeses and sliced meats, boiled eggs, fruit salad, and cereals. The hotel reception was friendly and efficient (and spoke perfect english) . I really liked this hotel and if you are having a weekend break in Berlin I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: pukran
Reviews.Content: Good points: 1. Five min walk from Alexanderplatz railway station 2. Very close to Unter den Linden and all it's sights and attractions, 3. Clean rooms 4. Good breakfast and excellent coffee (6 am to 10 am only though) Bad points (many): 1. No baby cots (!) 2. No tea/ coffee making facilities i.e. kettles in the rooms (this is shocking and the first time we've encountered this problem in a "proper" hotel) 3. No bath tubs in any of the rooms 4. Heating very hit and miss, if left on: makes the room stuffy and suffocatingly hot, if left off: room gets cold quickly 5. No table fans available if required 6. Railway tracks run along the hotel: so very noisy. The rooms away from the tracks have a depressing view of the wall of an adjoining building 7. Far too expensive: we paid 107 Euros per night per room including breakfast and this is only a 2 star hotel. The 4 star Park Inn nearby costs only 89 Euros per night (without breakfast but far better facilities and outstanding views of the city: we stayed there for one night only as it was fully booked on the other dates)

Reviews.Title: “What A Gem - Especially For The Price!”
Reviews.Author: NETTSTER
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Europe for three weeks in June with six other professional women aged 40 to 60. Because we don't spend a lot of time in the rooms, we didn't require the Ritz. However, we wanted something modern, clean, safe, with good service in a good central location for sightseeing. The Motel One Alexanderplatz definitely lived up to our expectations, especially trying to please seven women who have traveled extensively throughout the world. Our trip began in Berlin for the first three nights at this hotel. We were definitely pleased from the start with the easy bus system to/from the airport to the hotel, walking distance to great restaurants and bars and Museum Island, subway a block away, great clean rooms that were quiet and good service. We had originally booked the Marriott, but switched to this hotel after reading the reviews on TA and getting a great price. The rooms are not spacious, but the location can't be beat, the lobby is nice, and the rooms are very modern, comfortable, and clean. Two thumbs up, especially considering the good price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_and_Erik
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Motel One while on a business trip. The name, Motel one, scared me off . Makes you think of some dirty old motel but this place is actually really good. The hotel is categorized as a two star hotel but I would say that it feels like a four star! The location is brilliant, walking distance to most places and if you prefer not using your legs train, buses and s-bahn are all close by. The rooms are very nice and clean and good sized. There's a flat screen in the room with a built in DVD which could be very convenient for some I guess. The bathroom was nice and modern, kind of luxurious too with black granite, black mosaic and white tiles. A lot nicer than you would expect in a two star hotel. The breakfast was good with plenty of things to choose from and there's a little garden so at night you can have a glass of wine outside if you feel like it. I would definitely recommend the hotel as it is excellent value for money. I would however recommend you to ask for a room facing the garden, not the street. Some of my colleagues found the trains outside noisy.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location, lovely rooms.....”
Reviews.Author: TamboLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel ,ideally located 3 mins to bars in hackerscher markt, train station 2 mins away. Wouldnt bother with breakfast as numerous cafes around hotel. Great shopping just around the corner. Would definately go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: StijnVercamer
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a very good balance between price and quality. It's actually pretty cheap! The rooms, the staff, the breakfast, ... Everything is highly professional. The U-Bahn is not far and the Hackescher Markt is just a block away. If I ever go back to Berlin, I will not have any doubt about my hotel-choice.

Reviews.Title: “One in a million!!!”
Reviews.Author: Daninboise
Reviews.Content: the rooms, the rates, the location, the staff... nothing could beat this place! stay here. Decent lounge, and good breakfast (hard cooked eggs, juice, coffee/tea/cocoa; breads, spreads, yogurts)

Reviews.Title: “Groovie, Zen-Like Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: NanBug
